intro: Millettia pubinervis, commonly known as the hairy-veined millettia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with hairy veins, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, and its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds. Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
